{{Infobox military person | name=Rüdiger Overmans | image = | caption = | birth_date = {{b-da|6 April 1954}} | death_date = | birth_place = [[Düsseldorf]] | death_cause = | nationality = [[German]] | branch = [[Bundeswehr]] | serviceyears = 1972–2004 | rank = [[Lt. Colonel]] | education = [[Bundeswehr University Munich]] 1974–1977.
[[Bundeswehr University Hamburg]] Ph.D. 1986 | occupation = [[Historian]] | spouse = | children = | laterwork = ''Deutsche militärische Verluste im Zweiten Weltkrieg'' [German Military Losses in World War II]. Oldenbourg, München, 2004. ISBN 3-486-20028-3.}} '''Rüdiger Overmans''' (born 6. April 1954 in [[Düsseldorf]]) is German [[military historian]] who specialized in World War II history. His work "''German Military Losses in World War II''", which he conducted as leader of a project sponsored by the Gerda Henkel foundation,Rüdiger Overmans. Deutsche militärische Verluste im Zweiten Weltkrieg. Oldenbourg 2000. ISBN 3-486-56531-1 Noted by Overmans in his preface is the most complete reference work about [[German casualties in World War II]].{{cite web|url=http://jungefreiheit.de/kultur/2005/55-millionen-schicksale/ |title=5,5 Millionen Schicksale |publisher=Junge Freiheit |date=17 June 2005|language=German}} == Biography == Overmans joined the [[Bundeswehr]] in 1972, and studied economics at the [[Bundeswehr University Munich]] from 1974 to 1977. He completed his Ph.D. in 1982–1986 at the Bundeswehr University Hamburg, now known as [[Helmut Schmidt University]]. From 1987 to 2004 he was a research associate at the [[German Armed Forces Military History Research Office|Military History Research Office (MGFA)]], first in [[Freiburg]] and later in [[Potsdam]]. In 1996 he received his doctorate in history with the seminal work ''German Military Losses in World War II'' at the [[University of Freiburg]].{{citation|url=http://www.ruediger-overmans.de/ |title=Rüdiger Overmans Home page}} This study was first published in 1999 in Munich by {{illm|Oldenbourg Verlag|de|R. Oldenbourg Verlag}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/feuilleton/politik/rezension-sachbuch-5-3-millionen-gefallene-110707.html |title=5,3 Millionen Gefallene |publisher=Frankfurter Algemeine Zeitung |date=07.06.2000 |last=Hartmann |first=Christian |authorlink=Christian Hartmann (historian)|language=German}} From 1996 to 2001, Overmans lectured at the History Department of the University of Freiburg. Until his retirement in 2004, he had reached the military rank of [[lieutenant colonel]]. Since then he has worked as a freelance historian. He participated in a commission which issued an opinion to the number of victims in the [[Dresden bombing]] in February 1945.{{citation |url=http://www.dresden.de/media/pdf/infoblaetter/Historikerkommission_Dresden1945_Abschlussbericht_V1_14a.pdf |title=Final Report of the Historical Commission of the air raids on Dresden}} == Works== Main works by Overmans include: ===Monographies=== * {{cite book|title=''Deutsche militärische Verluste im Zweiten Weltkrieg'' |trans_title=German Military Losses in World War II |publisher=Oldenbourg, München, |year=2004 |isbn=3-486-20028-3}} * {{cite book|title=Soldaten hinter Stacheldraht. Deutsche Kriegsgefangene des Zweiten Weltkriegs |trans_title=Soldiers behind barbed wire. German prisoners of war of World War II|publisher=Propyläen, Berlin |year=2000 |isbn=3-549-07121-3}} ===Chapters=== * {{cite book|chapter=Die Kriegsgefangenenpolitik des Deutschen Reiches 1939 bis 1945 |title=''Die Deutsche Kriegsgesellschaft 1939–1945''. Zweiter Halbband: ''Ausbeutung, Deutungen, Ausgrenzung'' | trans_title=German Wartime Society 1939-1945: Exploitation, Interpretations, Exclusion |editor=Jörg Echternkamp |series=[[Germany and the Second World War]] |publisher= Deutsche Verlagsanstalt, München |year=2005 |pages=729–875 |volume=IX |isbn=3-421-06528-4}} {{illm|Jörg Echternkamp|de|Jörg Echternkamp}} * {{cite book|chapter=Das Schicksal der deutschen Kriegsgefangenen des Zweiten Weltkriegs' |title=''Der Zusammenbruch des Deutschen Reiches 1945''. Zweiter Halbband: ''Die Folgen des Zweiten Weltkrieges'' |trans_title=The Collapse of Germany 1945 and the Results of the Second World War: The Resolution of the Wehrmacht and the Consequences of the War |editor=[[Rolf-Dieter Müller]] |series=[[Germany and the Second World War]] |publisher= Deutsche Verlagsanstalt, München |year=2008 |volume=X/1-2 |pages=379–507 |isbn=3-421-04338-8}} ===Editorships=== * {{cite book|title=''In der Hand des Feindes. Kriegsgefangenschaft von der Antike bis zum Zweiten Weltkrieg''|publisher=Böhlau, Köln |year=1999 |isbn=3-412-14998-5}} * {{cite book|title=''Kriegsgefangenschaft im Zweiten Weltkrieg. Eine vergleichende Perspektive''|last2=Bischof |first2=Günter |last1=Overmans |first1=Rüdiger |publisher=Gerhard Höller, Ternitz-Pottschach |year=1999 |isbn= 3-85226-078-7}} * {{cite book|title=''Rotarmisten in deutscher Hand. Dokumente zu Gefangenschaft, Repatriierung und Rehabilitierung sowjetischer Soldaten des Zweiten Weltkrieges''|first1=Pavel |last1=Polian |first2=Andreas |last2=Hilger |first3=Rüdiger |last3=Overmans |publisher=Schöningh, Paderborn |year=2012 |isbn=978-3-506-76545-1}} ==See also== * [[German casualties in World War II]], largely based on Overmans's research == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{DNB-Portal|121478890}} * {{Perlentaucher|2373}} * [http://www.ruediger-overmans.de/ Homepage of Rüdiger Overmans] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Overmans, Rudiger}} [[Category:German military historians]] [[Category:World War II historians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:People from Düsseldorf]] [[Category:Bundeswehr University Munich alumni]] [[Category:University of Freiburg alumni]] [[Category:University of Freiburg faculty]] [[Category:German male writers]]
